026F91187D334EFAABE05EC6CEAC3E8B.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

1973E8FD9AAF45F68791FAC707D67743.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

0C3A1329C0E84E68AB4FB3AAC3776088.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

5E7D59ACFD0648298419C1B18AB9BD3F.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

6A0108AB0FB7402C870F0460AA3CE335.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry

349F4FEB33DD488CB141D33120263DE7.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

0FC1CCF5EE844946B39B6155E083D82A.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

798CCCAFC5D74C4A8857036735FD66CF.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability

BBBA8DE3A45840F29A42FE6FE7F4EB64.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

110985987C4B4657835A1EB8430D6F9B.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

6346CFD2875D4C8DA869960F4C4A6E57.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

67DA275059BD4D66B997E68C49815C3F.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

AAAF7B0D0BBC4609B06D10B022945502.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

7AC4C2893EB246D6A5DFB668639F7616.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours? Who is my supervisor? What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits an,d emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear?, Is it provided?What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace? How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

1A380601E1B0418B90E7B7EBBA423549.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

91057EE595F64D44858B3EB70A139D81.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

98929EE759A7400093310F452F62E864.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

1F3D5485B4B84940AC0BB13D28D6A404.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

4A08BFAEBBC74DAE9C2F1A3845EFB799.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

F442B5EF3E9F4ADF863531272A4BA4C8.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

5C918892C2564BB5A918FF5B275B531C.description: Invite a community member to discuss foods and related stories that are unique to their culture.

BFD4610DE66D46D4827DD73547EDED08.description: Prepare or describe the process of preparing a variety of recipes from other cultures.

74D351C7326449D4B812250F7839F5B3.description: Explore Canadian adaptations to a variety of international dishes.

2E6C5F80DD1048E28791E03D1203108D.description: Investigate foods from a variety of cultures found in the local community considering elements such as: cooking methods; nutritive value; ingredients; preparation time; and, how it fits into Canada’s Food Guide.

82FFD6532C564A81B500293F185F9A64.description: Examine reasons (e.g., accessibility, availability, nutrition value, cost, ease of storage) why some foods in various cultures are considered staple foods.

94983A38F0994F6DA2F003BCE1D1D310.description: Research unique cooking methods (e.g., open fire, outdoor oven, underground) and equipment (e.g., tamale steamer, bamboo skimmer, tandoori oven) of various countries.

4CC93881D7D7494985F4AC6CC911F7F4.description: Discuss foods eaten in other countries.

5F83D782AA054856BD915B1F572BC22C.description: Investigate foods eaten around the world.

9B77AE0F16D541AC80733DCC89FA3EA9.description: Prepare or describe the process of preparing traditional Indigenous food items using oral or written recipes with culturally specific ingredients, techniques and equipment.

4AE4F721C9B54FFABF492E6F0B1CFBBB.description: Invite an Elder, Knowledge Keeper or community member to discuss foods and the stories that surround them that are unique to their Indigenous heritage.

E082E69CCBF44040BD14F761B5F75BD2.description: Explore different ways to include culture and tradition in healthy eating patterns (e.g., speak to a family member or Elder about food traditions, attend community even that celebrates cultural food, choose recipes that explore different ways to cook and prepare food).

E76523DD19D6468497A3BD05AF9A68E4.description: Investigate traditional foods from local Indigenous communities considering elements such as: cooking methods; nutritive value; ingredients; preparation time; and, how they fit into Canada’s Food Guide.

19028464F1F846D0ABB11C3EE5D791C4.description: Analyze the role of food in retaining Métis, Inuit and First Nations cultural heritage.

103AAC978E0E454D9A4912F6337C17A1.description: Examine reasons (e.g., accessibility, availability, nutrition value, cost, ease of storage) why some traditional foods in various Indigenous communities are considered staple foods.

6E9597A266DE4AD0A1671A2112B089B2.description: Investigate how Indigenous values and beliefs of self, family and community are reflected in Indigenous food traditions.

EDEE84D84AAB4E4FB4528146E3B129C9.description: Explore what can be learned about a culture from its foods and food customs.

E2A90120D5B04247A8EDFCEBB4B45C56.description: Examine influences of family and culture on personal eating habits and food choices.

594D95C6835F4C33B2B3809B7B72E38A.description: Research unique traditional cooking methods (e.g., open fire, outdoor oven, underground) and equipment (e.g., smokehouse) of Indigenous people in Canada.

951448D45A8642A28B529EF55B6CA9DC.description: Explore the cultural and nutritional importance of traditional Inuit, Métis and First Nations foods (e.g., berries, wild rice, caribou, whale).

BE2A5AB23E64410BB5815DFD429427D3.description: Research medical benefits of various traditional Indigenous foods and herbs (e.g., spruce tea, stinging nettle, fireweed).

53097DD1B7AE4A2199CE955985164DA7.description: Explore social aspects (e.g., traditions, celebrations, offerings for religious purposes) of food preparation and serving in various First Nations, Métis and Inuit communities.

BC53EE1572C34F9DB605DD5FC2325404.description: Investigate food traditions and practices of Indigenous people in Canada.

37C6CB78B8384AF8ABC713C55CDBC77C.description: Prepare or describe the process of preparing recipes incorporating at least one ingredient substitution.

7F7ACD89B8B8437E8DA46DE6531DB34A.description: Explore substitutions of plant-based protein for animal-based protein in recipes.

6FEACCAA86E54D88A39AE373053B414F.description: Experiment with using a variety of substitutes in baked goods.

0859FD115E4E4AB082A776F1AEB07366.description: Research recipes that use sugar and fat substitutes.

FF4C09AD01E34A868F6357C9DFCB205C.description: Examine various substitute ingredients (e.g., corn starch, tapioca flour, agar agar) that can be used as thickening agents in recipes.

1AE8886522C1474DAC0D6020C10F4B82.description: Explore the use of fat substitutes (e.g., unsweetened applesauce, mashed bananas, canned pumpkin puree) in baking.

0CF098168C634148941E775A5000551C.description: Compare the characteristics (e.g., taste, nutrition, calories) of artificial and natural substitutes for sugar.

9C3264597C244EA68B9937E622F600F5.description: Evaluate the effects of substituting one ingredient for another in different recipes.

7D5138694AE8436EA4A9E3A3C6C47400.description: Investigate ingredients that are commonly substituted in recipes (e.g., eggs, wheat flour, gelatin, lard) and discover what their common substitutions are.

923E163830EE4284910F594B1D7EB2D0.description: Inquire into the reasons for food substitutions (e.g., food allergy, missing ingredient, ingredient not in season, cultural or religious reasons) in recipes.

07F41C1AC4A44019AB4BDB0D8DBF6CC3.description: Investigate the uses and effects of substituted ingredients in recipes.

10E87D57A44F4141BA9AA7DC6E34A34C.description: Explore technology developed to reduce food waste (e.g., composters, biochar).

5F4AF5C6DC604E6FA742898375BC2EAC.description: Research the impact of food waste in Canada on a local, national and global scale.

86B03F5BD16848E9AC5ECE17DC9917AD.description: Investigate strategies used by corporations to reduce commercial food waste (e.g., selling “ugly” fruits and vegetables, turning food waste into animal feed).

CC3F00F2BD1E407FA7AF8E54376F5A42.description: Recycle and compost items used in food preparation as appropriate

7DA14A96A37C44229F91532FE3396411.description: Inquire into Canadian food donation laws for companies and individuals.

58C269531939457BAF192AC8AE65BC43.description: Examine the meaning of food labels such as “best before” and “use by”.

5D47C0ECF2AE4880881599C65F929D79.description: Investigate tactics (e.g., locally sourcing foods, sizing portions, taking home leftovers) to become a conscientious diner at a food establishment.

2A6797123F6E49DEBDB13D83BCED3BC7.description: Research practices to extend the freshness of purchased fruits and vegetables.

75DA3670688840D2AAC5C4A9F7E71CCC.description: Explore the shelf life of a variety of foods (e.g., seafood, nuts, various fruits and vegetables).

E066141AE58C41A6BEE81AFA76CFCB99.description: Discuss strategies (e.g., grocery list based on meal plan, using leftovers for soup, freezing extra food, awareness of label dates on cans and packages) to avoid personal food waste.

98ADEC495F5E4917867FE39E24D2C95A.description: Investigate ways to avoid food waste.

73C62E09417F43A8A1C448BBBC68D5BD.description: Examine how Saskatchewan farmers have adapted to meet evolving food demands in the province.

9B4A4B0D498A44A1B955A2AAEFDE14F9.description: Plan for and prepare a variety of foods that represent Saskatchewan’s food culture.

2EE7CA09CEBF4C9BBB31E279E32E36E1.description: Explore the role of various food-related events and traditions (e.g., potlucks, fall and fowl suppers, feasts) in Saskatchewan communities.

6415749B11674B50850A3BF6EF01A04D.description: Conduct an interview with a community member (e.g., First Nation or Métis Elder, newcomer, ethnic foods restaurant or store manager) to determine the significance of food traditions to their physical, spiritual and cultural well-being

2DD6AB4762DC4EE7A6058BD641A31E62.description: Illustrate the impact of diverse cultures on local food outlets such as restaurants, grocery stores, farmers’ markets and trade fairs.

41F7C764AB254779899A904685C644B4.description: Examine the health benefits of consuming a variety of traditional foods (e.g., wild game, fish, plants).

949A8FCD7E2E4BA0A3F6F8F301081937.description: Explore ways traditional ceremonies and cultural events involving food (e.g., Diwali, Lent, Ramadan, First Nations feasts) connect to one’s physical, spiritual, emotional and cultural identity.

3EA47CB027E24908836E4F32F5610A54.description: Explore the history of bannock as a cultural and colonial food.

C9CF0EBDDF2B48969420AD6DD7BC8EA5.description: Investigate the ways harvesting of food has provided a means of economic livelihood for First Nations and Métis people in past and current times.

91C3A7508434443AB4DFAB22BCF29C52.description: Research the significance of Métis and First Nations traditional food systems and food sovereignty.

F87F693DC6D8437693DC177FDDCE12AD.description: Inquire into First Nation and Métis food preparation techniques (e.g., harvesting wild rice in the fall, drying berries) that have influenced current food preparation techniques.

04C3E1741132465087C836654C070AEC.description: Discuss a variety of cultural foods (e.g., perogies, wild rice, Saskatoon berries, borscht) that have become part the contemporary diet.

71909994E865428EB540464E3C90A330.description: Explore the evolution of Saskatchewan cuisine.

02E4088DE7554D90AD4FF6FBE88B2BA2.description: Examine the heritage of Saskatchewan cuisine.

DECA0059E54C430F8C1645AD4762FF8E.description: Explore various methods (e.g., canning, freezing, drying) to preserve seasonal produce for future use.

6FF460BDBA2F4AC5A9C9534804F62E11.description: Prepare or describe the preparation of recipes that include seasonal fruits and vegetables.

B1A4DD72E5E94C0B84EEC201B39E2CB1.description: Compare home grown to imported fruits and vegetables considering: cost; consistency of availability; food safety;  freshness and taste; and, nutritional value

86E7E4EEBC534380909A6B02F0E43EB2.description: Explore benefits of supporting local fruit and vegetable farmers and markets.

6C84C60F2A9944058BF1F1DE530344C5.description: Inquire into how to grow, buy and prepare fruits and vegetables at their peak for spring (e.g., rhubarb, asparagus), summer (e.g., cherries, carrots), fall (e.g., pears, pumpkins) and winter (e.g., potatoes, onions).

B7E35C400FCB42C59A9497CD72733A4A.description: Discuss fruits and vegetables grown in each season in Saskatchewan and Canada.

743CDB4EA18B4EF0A4C2E4020A57F508.description: Investigate growing, purchasing, preserving and preparing of Canadian seasonal produce.

A90BD5585501408192FCF7D46715505B.description: Prepare or describe the preparation of recipes for food preservation.

67FA97BF4AF84BBBB2A8A27738415EC0.description: Implement general food safety and sanitation guidelines for home preservation processes.

6ABDD7DBC552466284DFBEEE60A3CF5B.description: Inquire into what types of foods are grown and preserved in Saskatchewan.

A04DB3B2D44744E2BBD979FDAF17E80A.description: Explore in season foods to preserve for future use.

A34C1F2CBAC0401BA9FACA5A2382DB23.description: Compare commercial preserving to home preserving techniques.

65FDBDE1BC984BF5B427F0D44C704AA8.description: Investigate foods that can easily be preserved.

2D95502766694037806CB962DD57FBD4.description: Research the role of food additives in regard to: appearance and flavour; nutritional quality; preservation; and, food processing

12E9B25344BF471A9B08A2FDF2726369.description: Research methods used to increase shelf life of commercially made foods (e.g., additives and preservatives).

41B8504001D34E2CA6B703E9EE55D42C.description: Explore methods of preservation such as: temperature control; dehydration; canning; fermentation; addition of preservatives; freeze drying; smoking; curing; pickling; and, immersion in oil or alcohol.

10E54C9632054F84B3206E3771F51056.description: Discuss the purpose of various equipment used in home preservation.

D142A512DC6F4A529DC3B3B49B4FAFD3.description: Inquire into historical food preservation methods (e.g., salting, pickling, drying, smoking) from various cultures, including First Nations, Métis and Inuit.

4D1D0B51CEF747D387F41BD002864CA6.description: Determine conditions necessary for growth and control of microorganisms, enzymes and oxidation in food spoilage.

9571132EC2D946E49F0CA4A028DB7A77.description: Explore how microorganisms (e.g., molds, yeast, bacteria) affect food spoilage.

FC544102D03149979B5539AD9642178E.description: Discuss reasons why food is preserved.

DA03B53F0B9C4021BBAD7DDA7EEECCD6.description: Prepare or describe the preparation of a variety of yeast breads.

8D0B298F3B7D4917A89CA6AB6C01FEC0.description: Compare bread machine and traditional methods of making bread.

5F6A902350E6419B9688E6FEEE31500F.description: Compare factors (e.g., time involved, cost, taste, nutritional value) of a homemade yeast product with a ready-to-eat yeast product.

97CA074C9EB24E38A4E0EBE854B40FE4.description: Research the origins of various cultural yeast breads (e.g., bagels, babka, sourdough, pita, focaccia).

BFAF03564DDA40BCB5986DA157F55B45.description: Explore ways to add nutritional value to yeast products.

E8DBA5AB318D4AD2A5B19B5D62DE15B8.description: Demonstrate techniques necessary in making yeast products.

AC9255FC231347AD82063DB3ABD2D079.description: Discuss the role of gluten in yeast products

0BA6B8EA1C9E49DE927C9F02E792AFA0.description: Experiment with mixing yeast and sugar with water at various temperatures.

32B63698CD5B43FD8FDFB81007EE6C07.description: Discuss why bread is referred to as a staple food in many cultures.

BB730EB74FB147CEA11EC6A6DACCE194.description: Explore the following aspects of yeast: • types (e.g., rapid rise, dry active, fresh); purpose in baking; optimal conditions needed to produce carbon dioxide; related terms (e.g., kneading, fermentation, proofing); types of yeast dough (e.g., straight dough, one rise, mixer, batter, sponge, refrigerator, freezer); and, proper baking procedures, tests for doneness, and storage of yeast products.

ADF65C1C652A4FAE913FA7420F1E9535.description: Investigate the ingredients and methods used to prepare yeast breads.

E29072ABDE354AD6801979EDB5BCE85F.description: Plan and prepare recipes for different salad dressings.

2C65F8AA21EC4600A40563FA61F9BF27.description: Explore a variety of storage methods (e.g., refrigeration, insulated containers, freezer packs) for prepared dressings.

F65AECC4CD4D40379E1148BA7E3DDAEC.description: Examine labeling on salad dressings to determine important nutritional information.

EB463110E27044F08FA4B5BC6699BFE6.description: Prepare one type of salad dressing and compare components (e.g., texture, flavour, colour, convenience, ingredients, price) to a purchased dressing.

25E5A8FC76324CF7AB76AC3E268B7DAA.description: Investigate ways added dressing ingredients (e.g., croutons, bacon bits, nuts, herbs, condiments) can enhance salads.

A78F927FC81B4ECAABA6C69F942E59D3.description: Examine ways to prevent cross contamination of ingredients used in salad dressings.

C1913FC028F140E88A20D7DBFF13FB84.description: Discuss types of dressings (e.g., French, mayonnaise, cooked, oil and vinegar) and how they are applied to salads.

A99F0B96E5E44E13A9B4132C9EEC05BD.description: Prepare various types of salad dressings.

E23F50383F3A47DD9083A9C7D78036BD.description: Explore the cultural and geographic origins of salad recipes.

3BE47A64196245C8B155A5A8B1F94CBC.description: Plan and prepare recipes for different salads.

6FA4A69D0F6945F79DDF3D0E2128764A.description: Determine safest storage methods for various salads.

8325A15E631E4D5895983B99E2671BE9.description: Explore how to prevent cross contamination of ingredients used in salads.

DFF05C1E625F4CA4B620AEBC406DADAB.description: Compare pre-packaged or store prepared salads to homemade salads considering: nutritional value of ingredients; price; freshness; and, colour and flavour

9C0FD0935A71452EB4D9EDC49961DB7B.description: Examine ways adding ingredients can impact salad nutrition.

341820D1E7054EEFA83095F160A1B76D.description: Explore the variety of ways (e.g., appetizer, main course, accompaniment, palate cleanser) salads are used in meal planning.

3661BD4E20CA4B9F98C5D5B7EC79AFD6.description: Demonstrate how to "crisp up" wilted produce.

013100A91DAE4C3195BB0B5F28A4872E.description: Explain the three parts of a salad (i.e., base, body and dressing).

1F187E0AC3184406B2697FD2CF71779B.description: Classify various salads (e.g., tossed, layered, arranged, cooked, molded, main dish, dessert).

84521076608E438CBD8AA59B7A05BDDB.description: Investigate guidelines for selecting and buying salad ingredients including factors that influence: prices; nutritional value; quality; and, availability.

3BABA60FDF2B4998B9539232EB2A1436.description: Identify ingredients used in the preparation of salads (e.g., protein foods, fruit, vegetables, foraged greens).

CFDC0FA241E14DA3BAE7B1A7ABD7AAEA.description: Investigate ingredients, preparation and storage of various salads.

41A64BF15DE243AD88502B9537FA897B.description: Plan and prepare recipes for frostings, fondants, icings or glazes.

2E711F42F02B4405A7B712A0B7F389D5.description: Plan and prepare recipes using a variety of fillings.

12DF2140C4BF480CA50C72C939A93151.description: Identify ingredients used to enhance nutritional value to cakes and pastries.

A1558A7027E7492386E64171CE21EC23.description: Examine types of fillings (e.g., fruit, cream, custard, chiffon) used in cake preparation.

7BA818AE4FBA4C1A95FA0DC7E431AD5A.description: Compare ingredients and methods of preparation in various sweet and savory fillings

EF484940E78C4B968468BAEB9E9B523D.description: Create frosting, fondant and icing decorations (e.g., flowers, writing, piping, covering) using specific cake decorating equipment

06A86C69078A4007823C791EF50E72CE.description: Examine the importance of applying crumb coats on cakes

CCCBB8C140D94B058F8DB9CD62C75011.description: Compare frostings, fondants, icings and glazes including criteria such as: ingredients; purpose; preparation method; tools for creation and application;  method of application; and, guidelines for storage of finished product.

DFF49D4C27C943A08CB38BA5B41FB1F4.description: Prepare a variety of frostings and fillings.

D7AF3353A3A94FA382A2A98AC6B2D919.description: Prepare or plan recipes for different types of cakes.

AE9DBEE951C442E3AB9EAB445DA5B54C.description: Explore cakes from other countries and cultures.

F7DAEAD6D129429493CE47FB81C51663.description: Discuss guidelines for storing cakes to maintain flavour.

294D4E2C62394F6886163C7CCAFA7FE1.description: Compare (e.g., cost, taste, nutritional value) homemade, cake mix and bakery cake products.

A1A0AC69604241F6AA7B59B6F9833C13.description: Examine ways to add nutritional value to cakes (e.g., using whole grain flower, adding seeds or fruit, replacing saturated fat with unsaturated fat).

AAD85AEB206F4FDFB9AC888D032E5B25.description: Investigate cake products made with different kinds of flour (e.g., gluten free, all purpose, cake flour).

B00C3C784B1E4B6495237BA9407CB198.description: Explain the techniques (e.g., handling of egg white foams) involved in preparing foam and chiffon cakes.

B7AF11FFDEBF40A9B5ABEA87114FCFAF.description: Research three types of cakes and examples of each (e.g., butter/fat or shortened, foam or sponge, chiffon).

3024B85D3930401BAA61B0660803ACC3.description: Apply terminology (e.g., creaming, folding, beating, leavening, meringue, cake flour, soft peak, stiff peak) associated with cake baking.

2E412F039DB1458CA75D28E77EE7D690.description: Identify important baking skills (i.e., accuracy in measuring, mixing procedures, pan preparation, baking and determining doneness, altering and varying basic recipes, compensating for failures) required for successful cakes.

4605EC0ADED942E5B40396977F68F763.description: Examine the role of ingredients used in cakes.

3507178F1597448E95D037CA64F569A7.description: Identify the type of flour mixture best suited for cakes.

D538F58543B44F7DB8A08CA9931595B4.description: Prepare or describe way to prepare foods using a variety of appliances in order to meet meal preparation goals.

0BEA7C523FF149D4A9AC318F73089F47.description: Research how the use of kitchen appliances has changed and impacted meal preparation.

B49D8158CAD3472DBA25B502D9A29ACD.description: Investigate ways appliance technology has advanced over time

8378A97ACE8B4C3D97DA4DEF1E0E4B54.description: Compare (e.g., cost, features, warranties) various models of large appliances (e.g., refrigerators, stoves, dishwashers).

B1A501618135432292E292C041EA82AA.description: Investigate the purpose and safe use of outdoor appliances such as barbeques, smokers and pizza ovens.

F9A2BE391FC64FD09BC3796494D1963A.description: Demonstrate how to use, clean and store a variety of kitchen appliances safely.

0E7656BF39584880B82F8EE14688732C.description: Examine strategies to maximize the use of kitchen appliances in order to save time, money and ingredients.

D949205E834243E2BC273063263E8589.description: Analyze the benefits and costs related to the use of common kitchen appliances to determine efficiency

546A609B4177479787024B78AEEC9D1A.description: Inquire into the use of food preparation and storage options that do not use electricity to function (e.g., fire pits, barbeques, cold storage rooms).

31EBCAFCB2FA4C40B767B80D6ED3592F.description: Identify a variety of kitchen appliances (e.g., crock pot, bread machine, dehydrator) and their primary functions.

8457F2BEBB5E4102812770B902A8604A.description: Analyze the use of kitchen appliances in making food preparation more efficient.

787C7839216247AD93F173B48DB3EF78.description: Explore the benefits of cooking at home.

78DBC2CA4397490DAE8E3F6C28683866.description: Apply the importance of meals to a healthy lifestyle by preparing a menu for three quick, healthy and satisfying meals.

F98161CDFDE74C42A0D9BDD7CA6F079D.description: Create a quick and healthy (e.g., variety of fruits and vegetables, whole grain and protein foods, healthy fats, limited highly processed foods) meal.

6786AE302B6041D0906DE0C18B7CE223.description: Plan three quick meals to demonstrate strategies for coping with different limitations including: budget; time; staggered family schedules; eating away from home; cooking facilities; nutrition needs; and, ease of preparation.

1CC437FB66024AE5B4F727B16A3CD851.description: Analyze a recipe and modify it as necessary to reflect specific needs (e.g., diet requirements, nutrition, culture requirements) for a quick and healthy meal.

4D2465EF1B2740DC830C3F729E8A3996.description: Compare a variety of convenience foods for qualities such as availability, ingredients, nutrition and taste

B723E67AEC164C96B8382526E9948EEA.description: Discuss possible factors (e.g., economic, cultural, lifestyle, flavour, enjoyment) that influence meal food choices of individuals and families.

96892A6B25D34B168E22BC0EF214B0B2.description: Compare homemade and ready to eat/convenience meals based on criteria such as cost, convenience, portion size and nutrition value.

B74D8D45CF484832902547D8C0D91431.description: Determine strategies for planning and creating satisfying meals using Canada’s Food Guide, that accommodate a variety of schedules and budgets.

02DF1126CB714C41A8D7F8A9898563CB.description: Assess the impact of evolving eating trends on individuals, families and the community.

115680A9F86F4E32B9112E1D75E9B28F.description: Investigate the effect of lifestyle on the eating patterns of Canadians.

BBEB56DC37814FCDA6D53BF510DE74B4.description: Prepare or describe the preparation of dishes that feature grains and grain products (e.g., flours, pastas, rice, cereals) from a variety of cultures for a variety of purposes.

E5A2FE04617C4989A6E45D6201F3A40C.description: Illustrate alternative methods for cooking grains and grain products.

65D6167E3395447990E67A4C7CC81185.description: Research recipes of interest that incorporate grains and grain products from a variety of cultures around the world.

B69A87D7F06B4E2F82A04F385FA1D45B.description: Research ingredients and products (e.g., flour, cereals, pasta) made from grains commonly available in other countries and the processes used to harvest and create them.

2DFD41A70F6D484BB68A99F5F8EEDF79.description: Investigate the types of grains grown around the world and the economic impact of grain production and food processing on global markets

170C7277F8BA4BC184E76FB67E41A9DD.description: Compare the importance of whole grains in food guides from a variety of countries.

9483A2BAB67544F99465F612AAEF0FD9.description: Examine the importance and role of grains and grain products in a healthy eating pattern

72E40FB677764DB18F12C0B76E79D43B.description: Explore key nutrients provided by grains and grain products.

085D26F8FB5B4EDDAF21B4B536637889.description: Identify a variety of grains (e.g., quinoa, wheat, rice, wild rice, corn, oats, barley, millet, rye) used around the world for food.

938A30026910411787119F409018CCCC.description: Assess the importance of grain products in global eating patterns.

E7059F9D237C4467ABD2F7B93E149288.description: Prepare or describe the preparation of a variety of baked products (e.g., quick breads, cakes, cookies) that use different types of flours

50A7C327152341878207A68F1F494806.description: Explore the ingredients in baked products (e.g., empanada, naan, focaccia, injera) from a variety of cultures.

0ACA3CAC9B97434BAF51F6D6F775CFE6.description: Evaluate the differences (e.g., mixing, leavening, preparation time) between quick and yeast breads.

146599013CD8412A9D9A94E78BE0F3D2.description: Examine leavening agents (e.g., baking powder, baking soda, eggs, yeast) and the gases (e.g., air, steam, carbon dioxide) they produce.

4D9288C82FC74624A6BF8D6BE72BB3C9.description: Explore allergies or intolerances (e.g., gluten intolerance) to flour mixtures.

E843D87DC97048A284B3F94E1D662F8F.description: Investigate the role of gluten in flour mixtures.

37DAF9399ADA480FBA01B48AB09568FF.description: Research types of wheat grown in Saskatchewan used in making flours

C806FB48698B418A9E34566CF6049796.description: Explore the characteristics and uses of flour made from different grains and pulses (e.g., corn, teff, oat).

1DF0003855274A59A3211711B007E0E1.description: Evaluate the different types of flour (e.g., all purpose, whole wheat, selfrising, stone-ground, gluten-free) based on qualities such as nutrition, price, flavour, characteristics and uses in food products

B8DE829823434F678E9E09E5750CA78A.description: Investigate ingredients and processes used to create baked goods.

EE8CDCBD8DE641DD8D24FCF783F5119A.description: Explore various food presentation and plating techniques (e.g., landscape, free form, alternative receptacles).

74FED2AF3D0D4643978F5B6D7030210F.description: Discuss components to consider when serving a meal to meet nutritional and cultural needs

8D2FF73A66BA46F2B67C391E9BBF7807.description: Establish teamwork guidelines for preparing, serving and eating food in the classroom setting.

2985A2594343453B8B9B1EF2586E586E.description: Plan, prepare and serve a meal at home.

57F8825DDA1D451CA00F6C198231B8F6.description: Demonstrate formal (e.g., cutlery and napkin use, passing food) dining etiquette.

AC5A456C136E4D9D928C98F202484163.description: Explore table settings (e.g., formal, basic, casual) for various occasions.

2DCCFCAAA4B546E1B5F458AEAD2176E9.description: Define basic cooking terminology (e.g., dice, poach, roast, dash, simmer, sear) used in meal preparation.

965B426C41B643EDBDC0E2B152028D5C.description: Investigate elements of meal preparation, serving and dining.

2E8434F10C5049F58ADCDA1D30107386.description: Demonstrate how to prepare recipes using proper food safe practices (e.g., frequent hand washing, avoiding food cross-contamination, washing produce, cooking to proper food temperatures).

10F9156D1C1A433DA98C7D6449C981E7.description: Examine safe and responsible recycling and disposal of kitchen waste.

2D1BDA7E53264D23AB619795CBD4DE2C.description: Demonstrate how to safely dispose of used oils.

295CCE579E5B4D34B6D66941DDA8E245.description: Research and compare the three categories of contamination: biological (e.g., bacteria or viruses); physical (e.g., objects that enter any stage of food preparation); and, chemical (e.g., cleaning products and naturally occurring).

31E3978148F04E0C8003424E15A24F37.description: Determine the causes and preventions of the following food borne illnesses: Norovirus; Salmonella; Clostridium perfringens; Campylobacter; and, Staphylococcus aureus (Staph).

6AC384715DF349CAAE10FEBDE68AF525.description: Analyze the conditions (e.g., temperature, time, acidity [pH], moisture, a food source, poor personal hygiene and poor sanitation) necessary for a food borne illness to survive.

E37BC11D9E2345B4883862A6804A6C63.description: Discuss the two types of contamination (i.e., direct and indirect/cross contamination).

43454E35A04D45BBB93D4AA08A16ED55.description: Determine safe food temperature zones for various foods (e.g., poultry, egg dishes, pork, beef).

F138F3F005234E2583063BE8AAB6412B.description: Explore aspects of food contamination such as how it occurs and how to identify spoiled food.

BC14AAB216F54B36944A7BF55CE23F98.description: Research best practices (e.g., proper food storage, wearing and changing gloves, using separate equipment) involved in mitigating the risk of cross-contamination for individuals with severe food allergies.

7C724BABDA944BB9872BF207EFDFD3C8.description: Discuss the importance of safe thawing practices using various methods (i.e., cool running water, microwave, refrigerator).

808FF61928A54AEE9B4B48D7409257C4.description: Explain the importance of proper food storage (e.g., dried, frozen, refrigerated, food-safe containers) in safe food handling.

C0F8B99D5FF7499982915E08F1A3D231.description: Investigate common symptoms (e.g., vomiting, diarrhea, cramps, bloating) of food poisoning.

FF549142614049BF984AA74903B444ED.description: Discuss causes of food borne illnesses.

2FBEBA01BC5344E9BC3B7FE9D17FED27.description: Examine the importance of personal hygiene and using personal protective equipment (e.g., gloves) for food safety.

4B3DA786D47B48659D706B2360BA57C0.description: Explore the importance of safe food handling, preparation and storage.

71452432D704442598C5DDABD68AF94D.description: Safe Food Handling A, B, C (Core)
